title.native: 愛してるぜ ベイベ★★

description: Katakura Kippei is in every way a high school playboy. Spending his days flirting with any female he can see, responsibility is the last thing on his mind. Life takes an unexpected turn for him as one day he returns home to find himself with the fulltime task of caring for his 5 year old cousin. Kippei's aunt Miyako had disappeared, appearing to have abandoned his cousin, Yuzuyu. With Kippei's lack of responsibility and knowledge of childcare and Yuzuyu's injured heart with the disappearance of her mother, their time together is in for a bumpy ride. Based on the manga by Maki Youko.

title.native: 愛してるぜ ベイベ★★

node.description:
**Pet:** Leo & Coco, dogs 
**Height:** 164.5 cm  
**Zodiac:** Cancer 
**Birth name:** Yoko Fuke (福家陽子).  

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/makiyokolca/)

Maki-sensei speaks of herself in the third person. Debuted at the age of 17 with the one-shot "Love Service".  She officially retired as a manga-ka on July 3, 2019 after concluding "Kirameki no Lion Boy."

Older sister of mangaka [Aki Mochida](https://anilist.co/staff/98554).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋ナツコ)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/193091/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nocturamayama)

Yamashita graduated from Kokugakuin University with a Major in History. He first started out in the industry in 1997 as a production assistant at JCF. Amazingly, he has never been formally trained in art. His talent for drawing was first discovered through various doodles and sketches he would make on company paperwork.

Yamashita's first project as an animator was on [the second Kochikame movie](https://anilist.co/anime/3547/). Some time later he went freelance. [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/) was the first project he worked on freelance. Around 2006, Yamashita joined [Bee Train](https://anilist.co/studio/5/) and started work as character designer and animation director on the TV show [Ginyuu Mokushiroku Meine Liebe Wieder](https://anilist.co/anime/771/). A short while later, the animation department at Bee Train was spun off into new company, [C-Station](https://anilist.co/studio/6074/), and Yamashita moved with it. Today he retains a seat at C-Station, but regularly contracts out to work on various external projects.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/奥田誠治_(アニメーション演出家%29)

Seiji Okuda is a veteran anime director. He established Project Team Eikyuukikan, a collaboration of several animators, which was disbanded by him in October 2009. He continues to work freelance, mostly as storyboarder. He is also a member of the JAniCA.

_Note: Not to be confused with the producer [Seiji Okuda](https://anilist.co/staff/219343/)._

Originating from Studio Boomerang, currently affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). 

His role as a main animator on [Ikki Tousen: Dragon Destiny](https://anilist.co/anime/1956/) attracted a lot of attention. At ufotable he is one of the studio's key members among people like [Akira Matsushima](https://anilist.co/staff/119808/), [Masayuki Kunihiro](https://anilist.co/staff/146702/) and [Masaru Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/146698/).

Held in high regard by [Yasuomi Umetsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101583/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋ナツコ)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/193091/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/numa_milky)

Numata is best known for his strongly distorted character style and peculiar sense for timing, often being named as an animator of the [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) school. He tends to work together with character designer [Kyuuta Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/106111/), whose disproportionated character designs particularly fit his style, employing often large teardrops, which brought him to spotlight in [Higurashi no Naku Koro ni](https://anilist.co/anime/934/). The duo also participated together in several other shows, such as [Ichigo Mashimaro](https://anilist.co/anime/488/) and [Strawberry Panic](https://anilist.co/anime/855/).

Every now and then works under one of his many pseudonyms.

(Source: Anidb)
